snippet: Critics said overhead sprinklers at the entrance to the death camp’s memorial and museum were reminiscent of the showers the Nazis used to gas Jews in World War II.
abstract: Auschwitz-Birkenau Memorial and Museum in Poland defends its use of suspended hose that sprays visitors with fine mist to provide relief from heat; criticism said sprinklers were reminder of how Jews were gassed by Nazis at concentration camp in World War II.
lead_paragraph: Critics said overhead sprinklers at the entrance to the death camp’s memorial and museum were reminiscent of the showers the Nazis used to gas Jews in World War II.

headline.main: At Auschwitz, a Summer Precaution Is a Grim Reminder to Some
